meanings.definition: A person who is bound or obliged to do something.
meanings.sent1: The obligors in the contract promised to deliver the goods on time.
meanings.sent2: The obligors are responsible for completing the assigned tasks.
meanings.sent3: The obligors in the group project were determined to succeed.
meanings.sent4: She stood out as one of the most reliable obligors in the team.
meanings.sent5: The obligors' dedication to their work was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: Those who are under a legal or moral obligation to fulfill a duty or pay a debt.
meanings.sent1: The obligors must repay the loan according to the agreed terms.
meanings.sent2: The obligors are required to settle their financial obligations promptly.
meanings.sent3: The obligors found a creative way to fulfill their debt.
meanings.sent4: The obligors' commitment to clearing their debts was commendable.
meanings.sent5: The obligors' responsibility to pay off the debt weighed heavily on their minds.
